scripts.say: Diadem of Light - Sunset
On the eve of the ceremony's commencement, a large banquet was held across the islands.
The islands were well-equipped with facilities for holding various rituals and ceremonies.
Despite the distance from the Sakura Empire's seat of power and prosperity, the banquet tonight seemed no less grandiose than the most sumptuous of Royal or Sardegnian feasts.
However, this banquet was not for the merriment of its guests. It was the opening ceremony to a ritual; the first of many offerings to the gods.
The reason the opening ceremony was turned into a welcoming banquet for guests from afar was simply out of convenience.
Instead of celebrating, many of the participants were busy discussing the coming ceremony.
Though the atmosphere seemed cordial on the surface, everyone was mindful of an almost-palpable tension.
As was customary of so many of the Sakura Empire's ceremonies, one could not help but to act respectful.
Banquet Venue
Ryuuhou, Noshiro, Suruga. I wanted to thank you for your work preparing the ritual.
I only did what was expected of me as a proud citizen of the Sakura Empire. There is no need for thanks.
Indeed. If anything, you deserve our thanks, Akagi. We could only make the preparations because you convinced the higher-ups.
And I am simply honored to be involved in the preparations you made possible. And, my goodness, you're even participating in the ritual yourself!
Oh please, you flatter me so.
Ah, how good it is to see you, Mikasa. I'm relieved to see you're in good health.
Hahah! Likewise. When I last saw you, you were serving–
Sorry, never mind. I would hate to be a party pooper.
Your heroic work in leading the Sakura Empire forward is truly commendable.
Why, I appreciate your kind words, but I am simply doing as the gods instruct me to.
In the years I was away, you founded the Crimson Axis with the Iron Blood, began research on Siren technology, and even declared war on the Eagle Union and Royal Navy...
Yes, and when you created the Reborn Combined Fleet, I let things run their course, just as the gods told me to.
Akagi raised her cup to hide her lips then whispered a question to Mikasa.
What are the odds that you would show yourself now of all times, having retired so long ago, Mikasa?
The Reborn Combined Fleet? That's just a side show of mine. You don't need to concern yourself with it.
And what's so strange about me showing myself "now of all times"? I have as much right to be here as any other citizen of the Sakura Empire does.
We are all concerned about the Sakura Empire's future and are prepared to do anything for it. Is that not so?
Of course it is. By the way, I have been informed that Lady Nagato will not be attending the ritual.
Rumors have circulated that she has already awoken from her slumber and is now under the care of your Reborn Combined Fleet. Though that is only a rumor, I have reason to–
Akagi was interrupted by the sound of a loud crash.
What was that?!
Its cause: Zuikaku, hiding away in a corner of the venue. She had dropped her porcelain cup.
I'm terribly sorry for the ruckus, Akagi! Zuikaku's hand slipped and she dropped her cup!
How could you be so careless in front of everyone, Zuikaku?! Goodness... Please, pay us no heed. We shall be on our way now. Please enjoy the rest of the banquet~
Zuikaku bowed in respect, then left the venue with Shoukaku without saying anything.
Sorry, that was an embarrassment on our part. I'd better apologize to our Iron Blood visitors, on behalf of Zuikaku.
Though, I must say, I'm quite surprised to see you all the way out here...
If you'll pardon the question: Is our cuisine to your liking?
It's quite good, actually. This sake in particular has caught my attention.
As it would. It's made with malted rice and water, refined through a brewing method unique to the Sakura Empire.
It is also often used in rituals, where it is given as an offering to the gods.
Malted rice, you say... That explains why it tastes so different from beer.
Should your journey ever take you to the Iron Blood, you should most certainly give our schwarzbier a try.
Ah, it's been long since I was last near your continent, much less the Iron Blood itself. Still, I have many fond memories of that time.
Such as when my old friends and I enjoyed a banquet together with the Royal Navy! Hahahah!
Let's not talk about those tea-swiggers, it gives me headaches. I'd rather flex my privileges as a guest here and savor your gourmet cooking.
Eugen, I brought a plate of sashimi. Would you like some?
Z2, also known as Georg Thiele, was the girl tasked with assisting Prinz Eugen. Before even waiting for Eugen's answer, she put the plate of fish down on the table.
Oh dear, don't tell me you've...
Apparently, you're supposed to eat it with some of this paste spread on it. I believe it's called "wasabi"?
I coated the sashimi in an even layer of it, as I believe you're supposed to.
Err, you've put far too much on it.
Oh, really? Sorry, we're not particularly familiar with how to prepare these things.
In that case, allow me to inform you! ...Please, Thiele, stop! Don't eat it!
(That must be her... Suruga, the Kii-class battleship. So jittery, but in a charming way. Heheh...)
Eugen, I've heard these skewers are quite good as well. I suggest we give them a taste.
Suruga dragged Z2 off somewhere, but it didn't take long for her to sneak away. She then came back with a different plate of food.
Please, enjoy the banquet to your heart's content. The night is still young~
